intro: Hymenodictyon parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved hymenodictyon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Olacaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded habitats. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hymenodictyon parvifolium is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
